Lotus Plaza spooky action at a distance
Lotus Plaza is the solo project of
Deerhunter member rocket hunt and after
debut solo album that that covered a lot
of ground in in all things dreamy
glistening ambient soundscapes
shoegazing pop rock tunes on his
sophomore LP right here he seems to be
limiting his scope a little bit kind of
moving in a direction that reminded me
of the last Atlas sound album parallax
of course Atlas sound is the solo
project of another Deerhunter member of
Deerhunter with songwriting duties
Bradford Cox I did review parallax and I
wasn't really that into what had to
offer mostly because to me it was a
little less experimental adventurous and
not that being straightforward or catchy
is bad but the stripped-down and
accessible songs that Bradford was
putting onto this album just reminded me
a lot of diringer songs Deerhunter songs
that weren't completely fleshed out or
colored in and this Lotus Plaza album to
me is is kind of feeling the same way
and yeah of course
Lockette punt is indy rounder and write
songs for deer hunter and and i think it
is a little unreasonable to expect that
there is no influence or
cross-pollination going on but with
clear production value and and more of a
focus on just turning out tunes that
have verses and choruses this new Lotus
Plaza LP to me just kind of feels like
an assembly of b-sides from the album
micro Castle there are lots of
hypnotically played guitar
Peggy owes on this thing drums that have
a really snappy timbre to them and on
most of the songs on this thing the
guitars the bass the drums are all kind
of hitting this quarter note groove
pushing these songs along at a really
easygoing tempo songs like strangers out
of touch or Dusty Rhodes nearly all the
songs on this thing to me just end up
sounding like deer hunter tracks that
that would have been produced with with
heavier or more psychedelic or more lush
sounds if it had been an official band
project maybe there would even be more
instrumentation a lot like that song
Coronado from the band's last LP Halcyon
digests they had a really nice saxophone
on instead a song like strangers just
kind of repeats the same guitar and drum
phrases over and over and over again
until the song basically slows down to
an underwhelming halt a lot of tracks on
here kind of hammer out the same idea
four four four to six minutes it's with
really a pathetically played drums and
guitars what's worse is that nearly
everything on here is soaked in so much
reverb I just kind of feel like it's
hiding the lack of sounds and
instrumentation and melodies and musical
ideas this album actually has only a few
tracks on this thing really stand out to
me the song out of touch has a pretty
blissful chorus the way the guitar is
kind of shine in on the hook with that
thing really climax that track the track
white galactic has a touch of
synthesizer and I think these really
high-pitched tones matched up with these
very bright guitar leads make it stick
out for me a bit and I really like the
acoustic approach of the last track it
felt really intimate in comparison to
all the other songs on here those are
pretty much the highlights for me the
other songs on here while they don't
feel terrible to me at best they just
kind of feel like apple pie
a lot of people out there love

to love this

hard for me to like this record on
Deerhunter albums lock its songs
especially on the last year after LP
have so much more character to them the
track don't cry from Halcyon digest just

intoxicating way that I love and there
is reverb on that track too but there's
also a lot of clarity to the point where
you can really pull the story out of the

resembles a lot of tracks on this LP a

much easier because of how much closer
Lotus Plaza has moved to sounding like

is I'm just not enjoying this as much
there's a bit of variety on this album
